content.question: <math alttext="the indefinite integral of, the fraction with numerator 3 times x squared, plus 4 x, plus 1, and denominator 3 times x cubed, plus 6 times x squared, plus 3 x, plus 5, end fraction, d x, equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

choices.label: <math alttext="the negative of the fraction with numerator 9 times x squared, plus 12 x, plus 3, and denominator open parenthesis, 3 times x cubed, plus 6 times x squared, plus 3 x, plus 5, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction, plus C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>9</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator x cubed, plus 2 times x squared, plus x, and denominator three fourths times x to the fourth power, plus 2 times x cubed, plus three halves times x squared, plus 5 x, end fraction, plus C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one third times the natural log of, the absolute value of, 3 times x cubed, plus 6 times x squared, plus 3 x, plus 5, end absolute value, plus C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the natural log of, the absolute value of, 3 times x cubed, plus 6 times x squared, plus 3 x, plus 5, end absolute value, plus C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>|</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="one third times the natural log of, the absolute value of, 3 times x cubed, plus 6 times x squared, plus 3 x, plus 5, end absolute value, plus C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
